creator: pjg@navigosystems.com
text:
When the sessionDestroyed method in the HttpSessionListener interface is 
called, due to session.invalidate, then it results in an exception, when trying 
to call getAttribute() on the session retrieved from the HttpSessionEvent 
parameter.

I have not been able to find any information in the servlet spec 2.3 that says 
that the session should be illegal to use at the time when the sessionDestroyed 
event is called. So I guess that it is a bug.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
See 15.1.14:

public void sessionDestroyed(HttpSessionEvent se)
Notification that a session was invalidated.

The session is already invalid when sessionDestroyed is called, so 
getAttribute must throw an exception.
